business.headline: OpenAI hits $500 billion mark as SoftBank, others buy shares: ReportThe latest valuation marks a sharp rise from the company's previous valuation of $300 billion and highlights how quickly OpenAI's value has grown as demand for artificial intelligence tools continues to rise.

Bribes and social media war: Import firm vs Chennai Customs over 'corruption'The controversy began on the social media platform X where Wintrack Inc, a Chennai-based import company, accused Chennai Customs of systemic corruption, saying that constant demands for bribes had forced it to shut down its operations.

Google layoffs: Over 100 design jobs cut in AI shiftGoogle has also been cutting back on management layers. According to reports, the company has reduced the number of middle managers by more than a third, particularly those overseeing small teams.

Market holiday: Are NSE, BSE open on Gandhi Jayanti, Dussehra on October 2?Sensex and Nifty gained nearly 1% in the last session after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5% and maintained its neutral stance.

Satya Nadella bets big on AI, names Judson Althoff to lead Microsoft commercial unitMicrosoft has elevated Chief Commercial Officer Judson Althoff as CEO of its commercial business, allowing Satya Nadella to focus on AI, datacenter buildout, and product innovation.
Why the price of gold keeps breaking recordsBullion has soared more than 45% this year, putting it on track for the biggest annual gain since 1979.

Adar Poonawalla in talks to buy RCB stake? United Spirits shares updateThe CEO of Serum Institute, Adar Poonawalla, is in talks with Diageo to purchase a stake in RCB, one of the Indian Premier League's top teams.
Are festive cheer and auto stocks driving the market rally?The stock market showed renewed strength, as festive season cheer and gains in auto stocks lifted investor sentiment across sectors.

DA hiked to 58%: What it means for government employees' salary and pensionThe Union Cabinet approved the proposal to increase the DA for central government employees and Dearness Relief (DR) for pensioners by 3%. With this revision, the DA rate now stands at 58%.
Sensex ends 716 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; Tata Motors up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 715.64 points to end at 80,983.31, while the NSE Nifty50 added 225.20 points to close at 24,836.30.

This Indian gold lender holds 3 times the gold of PakistanThe country's largest gold loan provider, currently holds 209 tonnes of gold in its safe deposit boxes. This is three times the gold reserves of Pakistan and higher than the reserves of Brazil, Australia, and South Africa.

Shah Rukh Khan joins billionaire club, Mukesh Ambani tops Hurun India Rich ListMukesh Ambani has reclaimed the top spot on the Hurun India Rich List 2025, while Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan joins the billionaire club for the first time.

entertainment.headline: The Game You Never Play Alone review: Promising thriller falters in executionRelease Date:Thu Oct 02, 2025 The Game: You never Play Alone series review: Director Rajesh M Selva's 'The Game: You Never Play Alone' is a thriller set in the world of gaming and cybersecurity. The Netflix show has promising ideas, but fails to explore them fully.

Exclusive: Lovely Runner PD talks Byeon Woo-seok's casting, Indian remake and more Lovely Runner has taken the world by storm, becoming one of the defining K-dramas of 2024 with its unique blend of romance and fantasy. The series' success in India highlights the growing cultural exchange and promising collaboration prospects between Korean and Indian entertainment industries.

Everybody Loves Raymond cast to reunite for 30th anniversary reunion special The 'Everybody Loves Raymond' cast will return for a 90-minute CBS special this November. The tribute honours iconic late actors and celebrates the sitcom's enduring legacy.

Twinkle Khanna recalls when she was called Rishi Kapoor's illegitimate daughter Twinkle Khanna shared a lighthearted story about being mistaken for Rishi Kapoor's illegitimate daughter. The incident stemmed from a birthday message on social media from the late actor.

Simi Garewal says Raavan wasn't evil but naughty, faces backlash Actor Simi Garewal is being criticised for her post on X regarding Raavan. The post has triggered a wave of responses, raising concerns about the portrayal of mythological characters and ethical messaging.

Bigg Boss 19 contestant Tanya Mittal turns the reality show into her personal stage Tanya Mittal has made 'Bigg Boss 19' all about her, with her dramatic dialogues and over-the-top antics keeping everyone entertained. From claiming 150 bodyguards to saying she travels to Dubai just for Baklava, Tanya made sure the show is more about drama than reality.

Akhanda 2: Nandamuri Balakrishna's film release date unveiled on Dussehra The release date of actor Nandamuri Balakrishna's 'Akhanda 2 - Thaandavam', was confirmed for December 5, 2025 on Dussehra. The film is a sequel to 'Akhanda' (2021).

Nandamuri Balakrishna's Akhanda 2: Thaandavam release date is confirmed for December 5. The film faced delays due to VFX work, raising fans' anticipation further.

MAGA influencer joins Elon Musk to demand Netflix cancel over Charlie Kirk 'mockery' After Tesla CEO Elon Musk called for cancelling Netflix subscriptions following controversial remarks on Charlie Kirk's killing, MAGA influencer Gunther Eagleman followed suit.

Varun Tej and Lavanya Tripathi name son Vaayuv at ceremony. Pics out Telugu actors Varun Tej and Lavanya Tripathi introduced their son Vaayuv during a naming ceremony in Hyderabad. The couple shared heartfelt moments and received wishes from prominent Telugu celebrities.

Qubool Hai actor Additi Gupta, husband Kabir Chopra welcome twin girls Television actor Additi Gupta and her husband Kabir Chopra have welcomed twin girls, sharing the news on social media. The announcement drew congratulations from friends and industry colleagues.

Sunny Sanskari X review: Fans praise Varun, Janhvi's comic timing as a stressbuster 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' released in theatres today. Fans praised lead actors Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor's comic timing and called it a perfect watch.

Patriot teaser: Mohanlal and Mammootty reunite for high-stakes action drama The teaser for Malayalam film 'Patriot' showcases Mohanlal, Mammootty, and Fahadh Faasil in pivotal roles. The film is directed by Mahesh Narayanan, with filming completed in multiple countries.

Explained: Karan Kundrra and Anusha Dandekar's alleged dating app cheating row VJ-actor Anusha Dandekar has accused her ex-partner of cheating during their time together, following which Karan Kundrra indirectly denied all such allegations. The row has brought renewed attention to the pair's breakup.

Fan re-enacts Rishab Shetty's possessed scene after watching Kantara Chapter 1 A fan re-enacted actor Rishab Shetty's possessing sequence outside a Bengaluru theatre after watching 'Kantara: Chapter 1'. The film released on October 2, 2025.

Kumar Sanu sends legal notice to ex-wife over recent allegations Bollywood singer Kumar Sanu has issued a legal notice to his ex-wife Rita Bhattacharya after she accused him and his family of depriving her of food and basic necessities during her third pregnancy.

Viral: Rishab Shetty's wife Pragathi hugs him after emotional Kantara premiere Pragathi Shetty became emotional and hugged her husband, Rishab Shetty, following the premiere of 'Kantara: Chapter 1'. The heartfelt moment went viral as the film received a positive response from the audience.

Happy Dussehra: Big B, Akshay Kumar, Sunny Deol among celebs wishing fans Bollywood celebrities including Amitabh Bachchan, Akshay Kumar, Anupam Kher, Sunny Deol, and Randeep Hooda extended heartfelt wishes to fans on Dussehra 2025. The stars shared messages celebrating the triumph of good over evil, positivity, and truth.

Jr NTR wishes Kantara team: Rishab pulled off the unthinkable as actor-director Jr NTR congratulated actor-director Rishab Shetty and the 'Kantara: Chapter 1' team. He mentioned that Shetty pulled off the unthinkable as an actor and director.

Awez Darbar denies family paid for Bigg Boss 19 eviction Awez Darbar was evicted from 'Bigg Boss 19' amid fan disbelief and conspiracy theories. He firmly denied any family involvement in paying for his eviction and clarified his personal relationships.

From Colombia, Rahul Gandhi warns of 'wholesale attack on democracy' in IndiaSpeaking at an interaction at EIA University in Colombia, Rahul Gandhi said the attack on democracy is single biggest threat to India.

Kashmir is ours: POK turns battlefield as protesters clash with army, 12 deadPOK violence: The unrest in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir, which entered its third day, saw Pakistani security forces opening fire and using tear gas to disperse the protesters.

Day 1 Live: Rahul strong but Sudharsan's unconvincing stay endsIndia (IND) vs West Indies (WI), Live Score 1st Test, Day 1: KL Rahul has looked strong and resolute during his innings but the same couldn't be said about Sai Sudharsan. The left-hander looked out of touch and scratchy and Roston Chase capitalised on it.
Does Gandhi still matter? Yes, and Rajmohan Gandhi explains whyRead an excerpt from the renowned historian-biographer's book on the contemporary relevance of the Mahatma.

Yunus reveals forked tongue, says Awami League suspended, not bannedMuhammad Yunus, the head of the caretaker government in Bangladesh, said the Awami League (AL) remained valid as a party, and only its activities had been suspended for the time being. This looks like a bouncer, given AL's archrival, the BNP, looks all set to win the next election, and the student-led NCP is yet to strike a chord with the electorate.

Is Karur tragedy career-ending for Vijay? You don't know Tamil Nadu's matinee-politics enoughThe enormity of the Karur tragedy and Vijay's instant, intuitive and inexplicable escape to personal safety has raised many questions: Is it over for Vijay's fledgling one-man political party that is the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK)? Why have Stalin's police arrested two non-entities of TVK and are 'Bussy' looking out for two other nobodies instead of going for Vijay's jugular? Will Vijay's fans trust him and turn up at his future rallies? And, is it the end of the political road for Vijay? Find the answers here.

Four injured in mass stabbing near Manchester synagogue; suspect shot by policeFour people were injured in a vehicle ramming and stabbing outside a Manchester synagogue on Yom Kippur. Police shot the suspect, who failed to gain entry to the synagogue.

The film entertains with witty dialogues but stumbles with a rushed climax and awkward scenes, says our review.

Salesman-in-chief? Asim Munir mocked at home over rock show with TrumpThe blowback indicates simmering discontent inside Pakistan over growing involvement of the military in diplomacy, which is primarily carried out by civilian leaders.

Fearing loss of government job, couple buries 4th child under rocks; baby survivesA newborn was found lying under the rocks in a forest in Madhya Pradesh. Villagers rescued the child and informed the police.

Pope Leo's ice ritual, a veiled dig at Trump and a MAGA meltdownWithout naming anyone, history's first American pope spoke on climate change and slammed critics, just days after Donald Trump made false claims at the UN General Assembly (UNGA) about the "con job" of global warming.

Rahul Gandhi a disgrace, trying to show Indians are brainless: Kangana RanautKangana Ranaut alleged that Gandhi had once again attempted to "defame India on foreign soil" by accusing the ruling BJP of weakening democratic institutions.

US may arm Ukraine with Tomahawks, give intel for long-range strikes in RussiaThis will be the first time that the US will provide such assistance to Ukraine, making it easier to target Russian energy infrastructure like refineries and pipelines.

Aishwarya, Abhishek sue YouTube for Rs 4 crore over alleged AI videosAishwarya Rai Bachchan and Abhishek Bachchan have filed a lawsuit against YouTube and Google, seeking Rs 4 crore in damages for alleged AI deepfake videos.

The curious case of Ladakh's 'pregnancy tourism'The concept of pregnancy tourism takes a complete U-turn when you head deep into Ladakh's Aryan Valley, where the narrative around the phenomenon has little to do with a better life or social benefits. Here, the story is tangled up in myth, folklore, and a lingering obsession with "racial purity."

Greta Thunberg, other detainees from Gaza aid flotilla to be deported: IsraelThe Global Sumud Flotilla, involving around 45 vessels carrying politicians and activists including Swedish climate campaigner Greta Thunberg, left Spain last month, aiming to break Israel's blockade of the famine-hit Palestinian enclave.
Was Mahatma Gandhi anti-science?He criticised science that prioritised industrial and military gains over social justice and well-being. But there is more to him than meets the eye.

Maharashtra allows all-night shops, but bars remain barredMaharashtra government has allowed shops and establishments to operate 24/7, excluding liquor outlets. The move aims to boost business activity and ensure flexibility across the state.

BANW vs PAKW, live: Rabeya Khan gets Sidra Nawaz BANW vs PAKW, Women's World Cup 2025 Live Updates: Pakistan are struggling against Bangladesh, having lost four early wickets. Marufa Akter and Nahida Akter haven't let the opposition batters settle down at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

Magnus Carlsen becomes father, wife Ella Victoria shares adorable post Magnus Carlsen and wife Ella Victoria welcomed their first child on September 27, sharing the joyous news with a heartwarming photo that drew widespread congratulations.
Lionel Messi confirms India trip: Looking forward to visiting special country Lionel Messi has officially confirmed his trip to India. He will be participating in the GOAT Cup in December, 2025.

Afghanistan's Rashid Khan blames media for 'second-best in Asia' tag Afghanistan captain Rashid Khan responded to criticism following his team's group-stage exit from the Asia Cup 2025, stressing that the 'Asia's second-best team' label was coined by media and fans, not the players.

Catherine Debrunner wins three golds at World Para Athletics in New Delhi Swiss wheelchair racer Catherine Debrunner made history by securing her third gold medal at the World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi. She set a new championship record in the 1500m T54 event as well.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
